name: 容斥原理
complexity: O(2^n * f(n)) where f(n) is the cost of computing intersection sizes
scenarios: Counting problems with constraints (e.g., number of integer solutions with upper bounds)
Number theory (e.g., counting coprime pairs, Euler's totient function derivation)
Graph theory (e.g., DAG counting, graph coloring)
Probability and expectation (e.g., min-max inclusion-exclusion for expected hitting times)
Set operations (union size from intersection sizes)
extensions: Min-max inclusion-exclusion (for max/min of random variables)
Inclusion-exclusion for prime factorization (e.g., Euler's totient)
